meanings.definition: An area of land under the jurisdiction of a ruler or state.
meanings.sent1: The wild animals marked their territories with scent to show ownership of the land.
meanings.sent2: The king's territories extended far and wide, encompassing many villages.
meanings.sent3: The territories of the ruler were so vast that even the birds had to ask for permission to fly over.
meanings.sent4: In the game of chess, each player strategically plans to protect their territories like a fortress.
meanings.sent5: The territories of the ancient empire were so grand that they seemed to stretch to the edge of the world.

meanings.definition: An area inhabited or controlled by a particular group or species.
meanings.sent1: The bee colony's territories were filled with flowers that they collected nectar from.
meanings.sent2: The territories of the penguins were covered in ice, providing a perfect habitat for them.
meanings.sent3: The territories of the squirrels were so full of nuts that they had to invite their friends over for a feast.
meanings.sent4: The territories of the dolphins in the ocean were like a playground where they danced and played all day.
meanings.sent5: The territories of the ants were a bustling city of activity, with each ant having its role to play.
